formattedAddress: 1220 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1220 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10028, USA

originalText.text:
I love your coffee shop and the comfort that is present in it ❤️ but I want to say, as a person who understands coffee, that it is very important to have the same standards. I really like coffee, which is prepared by one girl. she has a perfect cappuccino (temperature and foam) and I expect that I will come next time and get the same. but unfortunately, another girl served me a very hot and bitter cappuccino with the wrong whipped foam.

thank you for your attention ✨

originalText.text: Wonderful coffee pastry and spinach pie spot. Coffee is a light roast with milk alternatives including soy. The turmeric latte is the BEST in town and a must have herbal jolt. Don’t miss the Nutella roll and very nice not overly sweet blueberry cake. Service with a smile and great barista! Super spot. Warm indoors with great community bench seating.

text.text: Wonderful coffee pastry and spinach pie spot. Coffee is a light roast with milk alternatives including soy. The turmeric latte is the BEST in town and a must have herbal jolt. Don’t miss the Nutella roll and very nice not overly sweet blueberry cake. Service with a smile and great barista! Super spot. Warm indoors with great community bench seating.

originalText.text: This is the first place I've been to in NYC that has failed at making a flat white. It tastes like milk Other than that, great atmosphere and service. Will come back to try other coffees and pastries.

text.text: This is the first place I've been to in NYC that has failed at making a flat white. It tastes like milk Other than that, great atmosphere and service. Will come back to try other coffees and pastries.

originalText.text:
I’ve been on a hunt for a new coffee shop to get my work done in between meetings, and I’m ecstatic that I stumbled on this place!

Peaky Barista exudes a timeless charm. As you push open the large wooden doors, you're greeted with the comforting, heavenly scent of freshly brewed coffee mingling subtly with the distant, nostalgic smell of brick and timber.
Inside, the interior is an eclectic mix of industrial chic and rustic charm. As you’re walking in, the soft chatter, occasional clinking of cups, and soulful notes from a vintage record player create a soothing symphony, transforming this place into a sanctuary for the weary urban dweller.
It's the kind of place where the staff greets you by name, always making me feel like I’m a guest in a friend's cozy home.

The atmosphere is great but I keep coming back for their delicious coffee, its liquid gold. Their oat milk cap, is a cloud of smooth, creamy oat milk, expertly frothed to airy perfection. It caps the drink with a soft, velvety layer, adding a delightful textural contrast. Every element comes together seamlessly to create a symphony of flavors and textures. Its liquid gold.
Their freshly brewed coffee is so delicious as well, every time I had a cup it was always so deep and rich in flavor, I literally savor every sip.
I noticed they really pride themselves on sourcing the highest quality, ethically traded coffee from various corners of the world, and it is evident in the depth of their flavors, whether you choose a robust Ethiopian blend or opt for a mellow Colombian roast. This stuff is truly liquid gold

I highly recommend!
Ps: Their pastries are so delicious!!

originalText.text:
Very nice coffee shop and a pleasant ambiance.
It is hard to find a good coffee shop in upper east side, this makes this one even more valuable.
Roberta was very friendly and made us great flat white and breve cappuccino
